project.teaser: In spite of the ambitious mitigation efforts set out globally and addressed by initiatives of the European Commission, climate change is under way and intensifying (IPCC, 2021). According to WHO estimates, the direct damage by impacts of climate change on human health is...
project.objective: In spite of the ambitious mitigation efforts set out globally and addressed by initiatives of the European Commission, climate change is under way and intensifying (IPCC, 2021). According to WHO estimates, the direct damage by impacts of climate change on human health is between 1.7 and 4 billion ? by 2030. The aim and ambition of TRIGGER are to deepen current understanding of the linkage between climate, health and ecosystems (exposome framework) and to use this knowledge to advance society uptake at personal and policy level. To meet the ambition, TRIGGER will commit an interdisciplinary consortium of 22 partners in 15 countries that will develop an outreaching clinical study composed by a multi-dimensional approach that capitalizes also on existing retrospective studies and will build an international climate service for global health protection, in line with COPERNICUS initiatives. TRIGGER strategy is grounded on three pillars: i) trans-disciplinary investigations to build up systemic knowledge ii) integration and usability of research results and iii) development of practical know-how and workable tools to monitor, predict and mitigate risks for human health connected to climate change. The proposal is designed around the creation of 5 newly conceived Climate-Health Connection Labs in Europe that engage citizens, practitioners and policy-makers in a co-creation process. The approach will target areas exposed to adverse impacts of climate change, such as increased heat waves, air pollution and droughts, and will address key health issues such as cardio-vascular diseases, respiratory diseases and UV exposure. By overcoming heterogeneous technological and methodological challenges, TRIGGER will provide exploitable tools to strengthen surveillance mechanisms and risk assessment, to translate robust evidence of climate-environment-health relationships into actionable information and guidelines, to identify and prioritise cost-effective policies and actions.
project.title: SoluTions foR mItiGatinG climate-induced hEalth tReaths
project.keywords: Exposome, Living Labs, Cardiovascular deaseases, respiratory deaseases

article.title: How does climate change affect global health?

result.title: Stakeholder List (living document)
result.description: This deliverable is an output of Task 9.7

result.title: Identification, monitoring and quantification of exposure and health impacts
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 2.3. It contains a description of a framework for the combined analysis of the exposure and health impact data.

result.title: Maternal diabetes and overweight as risk factors for congenital heart defects in offspring - A nationwide register study from Finland

details.authors: R Turunen; A Pulakka; J Metsälä; T Vahlberg; T Ojala; M Gissler; E Kajantie; E Helle

result.title: Cluster brochure
result.description: This document is an output of Task 97

result.title: Guidebook on ethics requirements
result.description: This Deliverable provides a guide to the Consortium and it ensures the application of fundamental ethical principles and legislation to all phases of the TRIGGER scientific research work plan. The document will be in line with the ‘ethics deliverables’ that will be placed in the Grant Agreement and in an automatically generated WP called ‘Ethics requirements’ after the project starts.

result.title: List of members of CHCB, PCB, AB and REAB
result.description: This Deliverable will contain the complete description of all TRIGGER Boards. Specifically, it will list the members of he CHC Labs Board (CHCB) and three external advisory boards: the Policy Consultation Board (PCB), the Advisory Board (AB) and the Regulatory and Ethics Advisory Board (REAB). All this Boards' members are finalized within the first 6 months of the project.

result.title: Cluster dissemination and communication strategy
result.description: This document is an output of Task 9.7

result.title: Synthesis report on communication, dissemination and engagement tools
result.description: This document is an output of Task 9.4. The report contains a description of the materials and tools needed to implement the serious game, a detailed user manual including a clear guide for the participants and instructions for the game facilitators.

result.title: Cluster web portal and visual identity
result.description: This deliverable is an output of Task 9.7

result.title: Joint policy brief
result.description: This document is an output of Task 9.7

result.title: Barriers and enablers for engagement in local policy approaches
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 2.5. It maps barriers and enablers in the local perspective of each TRIGGER's CHC Labs, and in relation to people, including vulnerable groups in different contexts.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Outreach Plan
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 9.1. It is a comprehensive plan, aligned with research and exploitation interests and needs, that will define objectives, audiences, messages, tools, actions and associated calendar, KPIs, guidelines for authorship, crisis communication, and adequate preservation of exploitation and IPR interests.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Outreach Plan - first update
result.description: This document is an output of Task 9.1. It provides an update of the Communication, Dissemination and Outreach Plan.

result.title: Study protocols and ethics approval for the studies
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 4.1. This report will contain the protocols and ethical approval of the clinical studies.

result.title: Roadmap to tailored Climate health Connection Labs
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 3.2. It will guide the establishment and monitoring of tailor made CHC Lab structures. It presents guidelines, methods and tools to support participant selection, CHC facilitation, monitoring and evaluation. It includes key enablers for steering CHC Labs.

result.title: Synthesis of climate and environmental change, socio-economic characteristics, and human health and well-being
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 2.1. It contains a synthesis of knowledge (systematic reviews and meta-analyses) and list of environmental-related risks and their socio-economic characteristics linked to climate and climate change as well as their impacts on human health and well-being. It also contains analyses from reviews on specific health threats in vulnerable populations (children, workers, high-risk groups) in the different areas of the CHCL studies.

result.title: Inventory of indicators, monitoring and alerting tools, and models for historical, current and future analysis of exposure
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 2.2. It provides an overview on the state-of-the-art of indicators and tools for assessing exposure to climate change related hazards. Furthermore, it will unravel best practice and weaknesses of those tools to build an evidence-based fundament for the development of new tools.

result.title: Ethical guide
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 3.1. It provides ethical guidelines to be followed by research partners when dealing with citizens. It will draw on scientific literature, existing protocols and experience of consortium members in participatory research and citizen science.

result.title: Climate score analysis
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 4.3. It describes the results of the climate change scores models.

result.title: Cluster newsletter
result.description: This deliverable is an output of Task 9.7

result.title: Project Website
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 8.3. The document describes all exploitable products of TRIGGER project with a potential to reduce climate health related risks.

result.title: Indicators for health-related climate hazards
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 5.1. This document provides the indicators to be used in the TRIGGER case studies and for the prediction and climatic analysis of Task 5.2 to 5.6 and a description of the observational baseline.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - TRIGGER (SoluTions foR mItiGatinG climate-induced hEalth tReaths)

result.title: Mitigation and adaptation policies at EU and international level
result.description: This Deliverable is an output of Task 2.4. It is a report on the existing mitigation and adaptation policies, with special focus on policies favouring maintenance of ecosystems in the health domain.

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
